i meant to refer only to the controversy (or lack thereof) for the 2 titles/publishers.

to be fair, it's been equally long since I read Northstar's coming out.

consider this: there was a long time fan belief that Element Lad was gay.  when Levitz and Giffen introduced Shvauaghn, a lot of people were disappointed that Jan appeared to be hetero.  This issue a) implies Jan isn't allowed to be bisexual or amend his sexual interests (because if he could, why would they to go to such crazy, complicated lengths to force his interest in a man) and b) marginalizes gender identity issues to the point that anyone who wants to switch genders just has to pop a pill but still must hide deep down their "condition", even to the person they love so much that they'd undergo such treatments.

Finally, the any progressive storytelling is undermined by the fact that this was retcon #300 in a run that heavily revised continuity and revealed "shocking secrets" about the Legion's past.  It happened so much that it started to look like they were just actively trying to piss off longtime fans with an "everything you cherish from your childhood is wrong" approach.
